DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator related to the appearance of the chromosomal makeup of a somatic cell in an individual or species, including the number and arrangement and size and structure of the chromosomes where there is a loss of any genetic material on a chromosome, ranging from loss of a single nucleotide, to loss of part or all of a gene, to loss of a visible portion of the chromosome involving multiple genes.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the appearance of the chromosomal makeup of a somatic cell in an individual or species, including the number and arrangement and size and structure of the chromosomes where there is a loss of any genetic material on a chromosome, ranging from loss of a single nucleotide, to loss of part or all of a gene, to loss of a visible portion of the chromosome involving multiple genes.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Karyotype; the appearance of the chromosomal makeup of a somatic cell in an individual or species, including the number and arrangement and size and structure of the chromosomes.

Concepts.definition: The chromosomal morphology and number in somatic cells of an individual.

Property.preferredDefinition: A loss of any genetic material on a chromosome, ranging from loss of a single nucleotide, to loss of part or all of a gene, to loss of a visible portion of the chromosome involving multiple genes. Deletions often disrupt gene or protein function and cell function as a result.:The smallest units of living structure capable of independent existence, composed of a membrane-enclosed mass of protoplasm and containing a nucleus or nucleoid.

Concepts.definition: Any rearrangement to the genomic content that results in the loss of one or more nucleotides of DNA. Deletions are generally irreversible rearrangements. They may alter the reading frame of a gene, or may result in loss of large chromosomal regions.
The smallest units of living structure capable of independent existence, composed of a membrane-enclosed mass of protoplasm and containing a nucleus or nucleoid.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

DataElementConcept.origin: SWOG CRF:Southwest Oncology Group Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.
